lessons.outcome: It is time for the  students to practice typing letters and  common words to increase their proficiency in digital skills. The child will learn typing on a qwerty  keyboard which is important in our contemporary digital world. As children hear the sound read out-loud, see it on the screen and then type the corresponding key, the activity reinforces sound letter mapping skill in them.
lessons.name: Type Alphabet

lessons.outcome: This lesson gives importance to teaching word families, also called phonograms or “chunks,” which are groups of words that have a predictable pattern or “chunk.” Since word families have a common feature or pattern in the end and they all rhyme, it makes reading them easy for our early readers. They have the same letter combinations which create similar sounds. They are wonderful tools for those new to reading and for learning spellings. Here the words end in eese and eat.
lessons.name: eese, eat

They have the same letter combinations which create similar sounds. They are wonderful tools for those new to reading and for learning spellings. Here the words end in id and ide

lessons.outcome: Typically two or more consonants are blended together to form a single sound in diagraphs - for example the two letters c and h have two distinct sounds but when combined in words like chair they make just one sound.
lessons.name: Blend - ch

lessons.outcome: Typically two or more consonants are blended together to form a single sound in diagraphs - for example the two letters c and h have two distinct sounds but when combined in words like chair they make just one sound.
lessons.name: Blend - ch- 2

lessons.outcome: Children learn the sound of consonants 't' and 'h' when blended together when they form words like that, them,then, they, this etc
lessons.name: Blend - th

lessons.outcome: Challenges are in-built test/exams for children. Students will have to pass the challenge positioned after ever 3-4 lessons with a good score to unlock further lessons.
lessons.name: Challenge Blend 1

lessons.outcome: Children learn the sound of consonants 't' and 'h' when blended together when they form words like father, mother, brother etc
lessons.name: Blend - th - 2

lessons.outcome: Sh' sound blend is important since many words in English language involves the blend of these consonants. An important step in learning to read is blending the sounds we know together to make words. Children learn how consonants 's' and 'h' combine to form single sound in word like ship, shop, rush etc
lessons.name: Blend - sh

lessons.outcome: Sh' sound blend is important since many words in English language involves the blend of these consonants. An important step in learning to read is blending the sounds we know together to make words. Children learn how consonants 's' and 'h' combine to form single sound in word like shot, show, shut etc
lessons.name: Blend - sh 2

lessons.outcome: Sh' sound blend is important since many words in English language involves the blend of these consonants. An important step in learning to read is blending the sounds we know together to make words. Children learn how consonants 's' and 'h' combine to form single sound in word like fresh, push, shake etc

lessons.outcome: Sh' sound blend is important since many words in English language involves the blend of these consonants. An important step in learning to read is blending the sounds we know together to make words. Children learn how consonants 's' and 'h' combine to form single sound in word like fresh, push, shake etc
lessons.name: Blend - sh - 3

lessons.outcome: An important step in learning to read is blending the sounds we know together to make words. Children learn how consonants 'w' and 'h' combine in words like what, which, whiz etc
lessons.name: Blend - wh

lessons.outcome: Teaches about how two consonants 'c' and 'k' blend to create a single sound in words like clock, duck, black etc
lessons.name: Blend - ck

lessons.outcome: The speed of typing is tested for children here as they recognize the letter and type them. It is time for the  students to practice typing letters and  common words to increase their proficiency in digital skills. The child will learn typing on a qwerty  keyboard which is important in our contemporary digital world. As children hear the sound read out-loud, see it on the screen and then type the corresponding key, the activity reinforces sound letter mapping skill in them.
lessons.name: Type Alpahbet

lessons.outcome: The speed of typing is tested for children here as they recognize the word and type them. As children hear the sound read out-loud, see it on the screen and then type the corresponding key, the activity reinforces sound letter mapping skill in them.

lessons.outcome: English spellings are one of the foundational skills which is essential for successful written communication. Children have to learn proper ways to spell words in their early stages of learning, since a word learnt to spell wrong will have to be unlearned to learn right spellings. The lesson teaches simple 3 letter words.

lessons.outcome: The lesson teaches basic sentences to children. Here the sentences are of 2 words like 'Ram eats', 'Birds fly', 'Salma walks', etc which are complete in itself.

Though the sentences are short, they are well-formed sentences with correct grammar which is necessary for children to learn about the rules of their language. Here the sentences are of 3 words like 'I am fast', 'The plant grows', 'You are kind', etc which are complete in itself.

lessons.outcome: The lesson teaches basic sentences to children. Though the sentences are short, they are well-formed sentences with correct grammar which is necessary for children to learn about the rules of their language. Here the sentences are of 4 words like 'The girl is hungry', 'Where is the cat?', 'They are my brothers', etc which are complete in itself.

lessons.outcome: This gives importance to teaching word families, also called phonograms or “chunks,” which are groups of words that have a predictable pattern or “chunk.” Since word families have a common feature or pattern in the end and they all rhyme, it makes reading them easy for our early readers. They have the same letter combinations which create similar sounds. They are wonderful tools for those new to reading and for learning spellings.
lessons.name: Noun - Person

lessons.outcome: Challenges are in-built test/exams for children. Students will have to pass the challenge positioned after ever 3-4 lessons with a good score to unlock further lessons.
